Nicole Kidman has admitted that her daughters would have said her plunging BAFTAs gown was "too low". 
The 49-year-old actress wore asparkly black dress as she posed for photos on the red carpet at the 70th British Academy Film Awards held at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday, but admits her daughters would have thought the low cut outfit was too risqu√©. 
Speaking on the red carpet, she said: "It's too low. If they'd had their say I wouldn't have been allowed out in it because it's low cut! Read More BAFTA Awards 2017 - see the winner's list in full as La La Land leads way Nicole's kids wouldn't have approved of her low-cut dress (Photo: Rex Features) 
"They would have gone, 'No, mum. That's a rude dress.' They like me more in dresses that make me look like a fairy or a princess." 
Meanwhile, Nicole - who has Faith, six, and Sunday, eight, with her spouse Keith Urban and Connor, 22, and Isabella, 24, with her ex-husband Tom Cruise - previously revealed she relies on her youngest children for style advice.
